GPA is your grade points  then divided by number of modules (not exactly but it gets my point across)
If you SU your B it won't count towards the denominator so you'll be dividing by smaller numbers
Your GPA will then be more easily affected by a B
Not just a B  also Cs
Its q simple. If you aiming for fch you SU ur b+. If not  you keep it.
Itâ€™s not that simple taking into account that the majority of your SUs is applied in Y1 and while you may want to aim for FCH  SUing a B+ might bite you down the road.

I don't think so  cos a B+ wont pull you from a second lower to a second upper.
So its basically a dead grade
With B+s around  you can pull your GPA up with A- easier. Without B+s  you might need to straight up get A to pull it up.
